text:
I can't recall when i first heard or saw Ace Attorney but i played the third game on a 300-in-1 games DS cart and thought it was very impressive so i just went ahead and bought the Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney collection on the Switch.


Utterly blown away. What a masterpiece of a game series. Still haven't beat it, just started Justice For All, beat the first game after like 30 hours of playing. Beyond amazing. Wish i heard of it earlier.


Been a long time since i felt quite like i did when this music played at the end of the episode and it showed the picture of Maya and Phoenix shaking hands with Mia in the background. Won't forget it for a long while. 



Gumshoe's my fav character tho.

author: ElRegrs

text:
The game would be just "ehh..." if it was a realistic court simulator.

But it's not. The characters are the main highlight of the game and the sort of cases that you have to solve have so many ridiculous twists and turns (that STILL end up up being logical). The games are a lot of fun, give them a try.

author: B A

text:
Phoenix Wright music is particularly great.
People always ask me, "Holden!  Why do you care to have the music on for a read-along video game with no dubbing?" and I say, "Because the music makes the experience!"

Okay no one asks me that, but I'd totally tell 'em that.

Courtroom music is particularly emotional - especially when you're shouting OBJECTION! at your DS.
